summary: Interactive romantic Valentine web page for Sunidhi with Yes/No options (No button dodges cursor) and a meme shown after clicking Yes; pink/white theme; runnable on iPad Chrome using HTML/CSS/JS.
architectural_notes: Use a single self-contained HTML file with embedded CSS/JS for easy opening on iPad Chrome.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page interactive Valentine prompt that asks “Will you be my Valentine, Sunidhi?” and presents exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”, with a simple romantic layout.

Implement the “No” button behavior so it moves away when the pointer approaches/enters it, making it effectively impossible to click (use pointer/mouse events so it works on iPad Chrome with a trackpad/mouse).
When the user clicks “Yes”, replace the prompt UI with a confirmation view that displays a meme image and the exact text: “Good choice❤❤❤”.
Apply a romantic pink-and-white visual theme with consistent typography, spacing, and button styling across the page.
Add the required generated image(s) as static assets in `frontend/public/assets/generated` and render them directly from the frontend (no backend image serving).
Ensure the page is fully client-side and runs smoothly in Chrome on iPad (responsive layout, large tap targets, and no reliance on external services).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed Valentine web page asking Sunidhi to be my Valentine with Yes/No options
Implement 'No' button that dodges/moves away on hover so it can't be clicked
